newsitem.title: GERMANY: Wayss sees clearly improved results in 1997.
newsitem.headline: Wayss sees clearly improved results in 1997.

text.p: German construction group Wayss & Freytag AG said on Wednesday it expected clearly improved operating results in 1997.
Wayss, which is majority-owned by Dutch builder Hollandsche Beton Groep NV, also said it had a 1996 group net loss of 136 million marks ($78.9 million) but that it was offset by reserves.

The group on Wednesday said its construction output in the first three months of 1997 was up 20 percent at 656 million marks and that incoming orders for the period rose 25 percent to 572 million marks.
Wayss, in addition, said it expected construction output for 1997 to total 3.12 billion marks.
